We'll be there. 7:00-8:00pm is our Critical Role panel, so if you're in the area, you're coming to the event, come say hello, bring questions, preferably not punch me in the face for getting it wrong with Anaheim.

So if you didn't have the opportunity to go ahead and grab your own Gilmore's Glorious Goods shirt, go to GeekandSundry.com right now, go to their store, it should be available for pre-orders for the next week.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.text: You can see in the distance, swirling between the trees, clusters of glowing elemental entities that are either spilling forth from this recently and have taken this landscape as their own, or are just enjoying in their-- elementals like to burn shit. And so you're seeing fire elementals wandering about, just tearing through what remains of this countryside, and let's see, you actually, Vex'ahlia-- as you guys are stepping forward, keeping an eye on these glowing distant entities, these creatures, you catch out of the corner of your eye what appears to be a number of other humanoids, a small cluster of shadowed individuals far off to the left, tucked around the bottom of a tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I ask everyone to wait. Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The violins go south.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. Glancing over in that direction, you see, towards one of the larger, broken petrified trees, right on the outskirts of the Cindergrove forest, you see what appear to be a cluster of humanoids. Two of them have flesh. The other two do not. These skeletal creatures shuffle in place, clutching a blade to one side, while the other two appear to be in partially rotted states. They're mostly disinterested in their surroundings and stand there, head to the side, aimless--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are they in the clothing of the natives, or do they not look to be Ashari?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can tell, one of them does appear to have Ashari wardrobe. The other one does not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- he said in a weird way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They look undead. Doesn't--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they from here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possibly. One looks vaguely familiar, but there's something wrong. We should proceed-- let's go up and find out what's happening. Slowly, and armed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Korren, Keyleth's father and the head of the Air Ashari in your absence, puts his hand forth and goes, "I'm sorry, you're saying that you see along the way undead creatures."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. There's something unnatural over in that direction. We should probably be the ones to investigate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Given the nature of the elemental presence here, we're going to have to "probably divide and attack the central place from multiple positions, otherwise they're going to "have too strong of a fire-front at the edges of this border. Do you feel confident enough to "handle your own sliver of this assault?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (scoffs and laughs) Is he serious?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog. I believe we can handle it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't have a lot of magic wielders with us, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all right--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (clears throat) I'm pretty good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A lot of magic wielders.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you're better than good, buddy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sounds good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cerkonos looks to the rest of you, brings up his one hand and gives a touch to the top of his chest and sternum and bows his head and goes, "I wish "you all great luck. See you on the inside." And the rest of the fire Ashari turn into burning fire elemental forms and begin to streak through the various broken rocks and pieces of glass-shattered obsidian that peppered this landscape in the caldera, leaving the six of you ready to trek forward yourself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan, can you do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, no. No, and I don't think I could learn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perfect. So.

lines.text: Let's go.

lines.text: Avoid the skeletons?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Avoid the skeletons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take a look, at least.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're supposed to make sure they're not part of something larger that's heading in--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're in the way, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you not just hear my father--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He said if they don't bother us, to leave them alone, but that we should just check to make sure that they're not part of something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they in the path at all, do they look like they're going to be near us when we go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look like, wherever you're traveling-- because there's an open expanse of about 80 or so feet before you actually reach the edge of the Cindergrove, and they're right on the outskirts of the Cindergrove forest, so lest you're very careful, they would technically see you if they're paying attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tread gently and see if they react.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have Pass Without a Trace, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do. But, Keyleth, the minute we start fighting, they will notice us, and then they'll attack us from behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So it would be best to get their attention now when everything's quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We also don't want to waste all of our abilities on undead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's only two, maybe four of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's four of them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That we see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we just tread that way, and we'll see what happens.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's exactly what we're saying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What could happen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I use Pass Without a Trace on all of us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we already have it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we already have it? From last time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As long as you're maintaining your concentration, how long does it last for? Concentration? I believe it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It holds for up to an hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An hour, yeah, so you can still be under that effect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I would like all six of you to roll stealth checks for me, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With triple advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Just the plus ten. Which is better than advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Triple advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With plus ten?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the plus ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Incredible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tra-la-la-la-la.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as the entire group bends down into a ninja-like stance, just darting across as fast as they can, keeping low to the ground and using much of the shadow of the overhead clouds and smoke that has completely engulfed the above skyscape, behind you, bounding very loudly, is a gentle gnome, swishing brown hair--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to do that thing that the Ashari just did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. It's not working.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hot, hot, hot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes. Mm-hm. Oh, disadvantage, because I'm exhausted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit. I forgot about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The honest gnome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You do manage to catch yourself, with a slight tumble, skid a bit on your ass, and land on your feet. It would've been a cool three-point landing if anyone else had attempted it, but you just barely catch yourself, look back at the group with a sheepish grin, and out of the corner of your eye, you see one of the undead entities turn its head and look right in your direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Good job, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) I think it saw Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It starts wandering in your direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we engage or keep going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm afraid if we engage, it could draw attention to an entire slew of what could be around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's just put it down quietly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, Jesus Christ.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No magic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just weapons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No guns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No guns. I pull my sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex, you might be the most capable of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I shoot it with an arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, roll for an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Just going for it. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm literally, I think I cursed myself sometime between here and San Francisco.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The d20s talk to each other and they know that you're not true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I attack on her heels when she's done?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this distance, it'll take a little bit to rush up if you want to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say at this point they're roughly 60 feet from you, so if you wanted to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's my distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, if you go full speed, you can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Daggers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, throwing it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 15 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 damage. On which one, the skeleton or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's sneak attack, right? Because I'm hidden.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be from you, yes. The--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Extra two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What? Extra two. Okay. Is this against one of the zombies or one of the skeletons?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was doing the one that was walking towards us, I thought the other ones were still in the area--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, then that would be one of the zombies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The arrow streaks through the air, slamming into the chest, and it embeds itself, causing a piece of tendon to snap and curl back inside the torso. Its arm falls a little more limp than it was previously, and it just keeps walking forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll a stealth check. You--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're all grouped together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three of them are grouped together by the tree. The one that noticed is slowly wandering toward you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I'm going to throw at that one as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 39. Stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to throw one, and just to check, I'm hidden, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So this is Assassinate, I have advantage because it hasn't gone yet, and it's a crit because I'm surprising it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. With that, as this zombie entity is hobbling forward, the dagger strikes it right in the center of the skull, right where its mouth and jaw hinge hit, severs the base of the skull to the spine, and the head just rolls off onto the ground underneath. The body takes two more steps before falling forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, do they all-- did any of the other ones notice that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the other undead creatures all of a sudden turn into the forest, as opposed to towards where the death happened--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see running out from the forest towards you, a blue-skinned humanoid, rushing out, arms in the air.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (in an Irish accent) Stop, stop, stop what you're doing! Stop it! What have you done? What have you fucking done? It wasn't hurting anybody! I don't understand it. Jesus Christ, these are not easy to make.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we killing this one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, don't kill him, he's precious.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: What did I do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are you? Who are you?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Who are you, you're fucking shooting at me, you're asking me questions!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But these are zombies, these are undead, these are creatures of evil!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They were attacking us, they were attacking him!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: These were in my employ.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you should keep a leash on them, then.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That would be inhumane, wouldn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not human.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, they were, that's very disrespectful of you, I don't appreciate it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they pets? Are they friends? Where were you--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: They're friend-pets.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have to be around, though. To keep an eye on them.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I know, but I've been traveling out here for a while, and so they provide a layer of protection. Certainly not great now. Now they were four, now there's three.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, listen, when we see these things without an owner around, we take them out, I'm sorry, it's pretty standard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This can't be the first time this has happened.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Now that I think about it, it's probably a little bit on me, I suppose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you make them vests or something that says 'service'?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That's a nice idea, as I'm a vest-maker.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Put them in a bright color, put a happy mask on them or something, so people know they're nice.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Certainly, yeah, yeah, masks and vests, that's a great idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see agreeing before you a blue-scaled dragonborn. If you would like to describe yourself for the party.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes, sorry, I forgot. Where are my manners? My name is Gern Blanston.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's not.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's Gern Blanston.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: This one's very rude.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He is.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You look exhausted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This volcano-- do you live near here? This volcano really takes the piss out of you.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, no, no, I don't live near here. Listen, I've been traveling, I'm a simple candlemaker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you doing on top of a volcano?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: A volcano is nature's candle! What a stupid question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You make candles, but you also make undead?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes. They're-- yes. They're like people-candles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I insight and see if he's telling the truth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Our lives are so bizarre now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. He's telling the truth.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Why is my brain tingling? Is someone noodling around inside there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She eyes you up and down, trying to get a feel for whether or not you're who you say you are.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I make special candles. I make special candles. I'm searching for some magical items up here in this volcano. I understand there was a wee bit of damage not long ago from a dragon that had torn through the region, and so I'm just searching for scraps to make these simple candles. That's why-- this is my dance vest. I think dancing is very important. I'm alone most of the time, it keeps me occupied. They have no appreciation for the arts, these undead creatures that are friend-pets, and, you know, I've just been digging around up here, seeing what I can scrounge up and find. What are you lot?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, are they special candles or are they simple candles?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, some are simple. Some just create light, and others create tragedy for people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're magical candles?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes, in a word. Actually, magic is the perfect word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who exactly is the patronage of your candle business? Who do you sell to?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I mean, I sell to no one in particular, really. I have to be a little choosy about who gets the candles, but it's something that I've crafted over the years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we feel dreadful about killing one of your pets.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perhaps we can purchase a candle off of you to make amends.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, maybe you could just kill someone else, and then I could just bring them back, I mean, that would be a wonderful way to repay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you know what, we're on our way to do just that thing.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Things do tend to die around us a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Something larger things, sometimes smaller things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you like a body to reanimate or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You might get something even bigger.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Are you inviting me to come along with you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. Are we?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Did I just invite myself to come along with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well maybe, like, if you give us one of those tragedy candles, we can always light it for somebody. That could be good down the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, like candles for funerals? That's sad. We do have a lot of tragedy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We bake somebody a cake, we shove a candle in the top, and we give it to them.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I don't think that would be a grand idea unless you didn't like the person very much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that's what I meant, yeah.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, I think for now I'll just hold onto the candles I have and just see how things pan out. I really don't know any of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're Vox Machina, a traveling band of adventurers led by me, Scanlan Shorthalt, and these are my compatriots. We're on a very important mission to get-- what are we doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to close this giant rift that we're walking into.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to break something big and scary.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: What's your name again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, what's the name of your group?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vox Machina.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No offense, but that sounds like a shite band.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Are you musicians?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's better than Tragedy Candle, really, I mean that's a shite band, to be fair.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughs) They opened for Vox Machina. They were fantastic. Oh, am I not thinking of the right thing? That's all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a musician.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But these people, they can't really hold a tune so much.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Listen, seeing as how that you've killed one of my undead thralls, it'd be really nice if I could join you to see if maybe we can scrounge up some other things along the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then you'll help us?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I mean, we'll see how it pans out, but I feel like everything would come to an abrupt ending if I just walked away at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It would be very strange.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Thoroughly unsatisfying for anyone else who might be witnessing this exchange.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your undead pets, are they going to try and eat our brains or anything?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, no, they're just fine. That right there is Coral, and that's Stimpy, and that's Fatty Arbuckle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who was the one that we killed?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, that was Carol. Very sad, very sad indeed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Carol and Coral?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Carol and Coral. I get them confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were they sisters?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, no, no, they were not initially related, but we became a makeshift family after a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's very beautiful.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I notice subtle differences that most of the living doesn't notice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aren't we supposed to be doing something really like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, tell you what, Gern, we're actually--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's dangerous around us, I don't know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably press on, and you can join us with your family.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Please, that would be very nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was your name, one more time?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Gern Blanston.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Gern.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, let's go, let's move along then, Gern, yeah? You good to come along with your herd of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you fight and stuff in case shit goes down?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you make magical candles, you must know a little bit of magic, correct?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm a little bit better of a spellcaster than I am a fisticuffs type of person.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Excellent. No offense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All taken.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We move along.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we still trying to stealth? Or does it even matter?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your dead things don't stealth, I would assume?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, no, they're really for protection. Now, the zombies can really take a lot of damage to the front of the chest and the skeletons are quite quick, actually. So, you know. They've been fairly good for a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We head towards the thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stealthily.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: To the thing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shush! Stealthily.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (whispering) To the thing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a stealth check, if you don't mind, Gern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does my Pass Without a Trace work on him too, does it like envelop him--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. He wasn't there when you cast it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's not under Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, and then-- No. As you guys begin stealthily, there is a couple of (footfalls) heavy footfalls of the lumbering dragonborn.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: These old dragon feet--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No tail on this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What happened to your tail?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Please don't ask me about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I won't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only other dragonborn you've seen without a tail was the paladin that worked in the Council. Tofor Brotorus. So, that does catch your attention a little bit. Not just the dragonborn lumbering, but now the three undead that are (groaning) stepping behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're worse than Trinket, Scanlan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. I don't know if stealth is going to be a thing, going forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whistling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! (whistles)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Mostly just fire comes out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it's at that point you hear the cracking of what sounds like heavy timber, no more than 30 feet away from you. You all stop in place suddenly and you glance over and you can see the flickering of light of what appears to be a flame-based elemental energy that's tearing over the side of a newly fallen petrifoid-- petrifoid-- (mocking Chris' accent) petrifoid tree, look what you've done to me! This is your fault!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gern, son of a bitch.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Purple hearts, green stars! Purple hearts.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seen some shit.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Special veteran's edition of Lucky Charms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very, very Lucky Charms.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Very Lucky Charms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that got dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, how about that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back to normal, then, eh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. As the flame begins to trickle and burn over the edge, you can see there is an intelligence to it. There are a couple of arms that writhe over the side and the head pops over and glances, and stops in place, frozen, staring over in the direction of the bounding dragonborn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a fire elemental?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's smaller than what you're used to seeing, but it is indeed a creature made of elemental flame.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would he be considered a primordial?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be considered an elemental.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to go fire elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you're using your transform--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seeing it, I'm going to transform and go into my fire elemental.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is this the first time you've done that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No no, she's done that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this the first time I've been fire elemental?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it's the first time you've been fire elemental, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, learned from Cerkonos, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you guys watch as Keyleth's form suddenly erupts into flame, which freaks you out for a second, as you're uncertain as to whether or not she did that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth! Are you all right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In fire elemental, just like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it still look like Keyleth or-- what does it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has for a moment, an essence of Keyleth's more lithe form that most elementals would, but still these long, curling flame like-arms, these eyes that glow a bright white fire in the center of the face. Other than that, relatively formless other than what looks like where her hair would be, these wisps of flame curl up behind her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pretty freaking sick. Can you talk to it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I'm going to go do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you approach the elemental form--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I approach and I'm going to do the animal instinct thing and poof up and make myself a little big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The creature behind the form, you can see, is drifting away from the trunk of the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it's running from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's turned away and is moving away from you, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was easy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deuces. And I roll back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we were supposed to keep them from coming out into this world.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we-- wait. Are we in the fire plane yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No no, you're just-- you're in the caldera to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're in the caldera.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're making your way into the remnants of the Cindergrove.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should ask it to go back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which I'm assuming it speaks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys hear in the distance this echo of this weird sucking-crackling sound that goes-- It halts for a second, looks over its shoulder and then goes into double speed, disappearing into the trees. Away from you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kind of following your lead here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I follow after it and I say, in the name of the guardians of this realm, you will stop!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you follow it past the initial treeline, it's where a bunch of trees have fallen over and formed a small blockade in this portion of the forest. You glance over as you're shouting that and you can see what appear to be another of the same small elemental that this one has gone to, to have a brief conversation. Beyond that, you see a larger one, roughly your size, that has just turned around and noticed your presence, and all of them look over at what appears to be another humanoid creature, but instead of a lower torso of legs, it's an elongated snake-like body, its black and red scales across its entire form, two human arms and a humanoid face but these webbed red spines down its entire back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gern.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, I don't know who this is. I don't-- I'm not familiar. I'm not familiar with who this is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take my potion of fire resistance.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I could send them a present in the form of a candle, if you prefer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point in time, Keyleth, as you're standing there, looking over this edge, they all turn and the creature, the weird-- I'll say it-- a salamander-like creature, begins shouting out phrases in Ignan, which you understand. It says, "Go! He's not here yet! Alleviate this "uncontrolled one!" At which point, they all begin to swarm towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At which point I'm going to do a fire intimidation tactic. I'm going to do a fire radial thing. And I'm going to say, as the leader of this realm, as the Kaitaki of the Fire Nation, you will heed my word.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Quite dramatic, isn't she?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are watching this from a distance, all you hear is (guttural noises). It's really confusing and a little hilarious, to be honest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's going well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make an intimidation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that one fails me a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, sure it fails you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you got, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does! Shut up, Travis. Natural 20!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ha. Thought I made a point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As this happens, the two smaller elementals shrink down and glance over at the larger one. The larger one looks about and shouts back at you in Ignan, once again: "Do you serve him?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It doesn't matter who I serve, for I am above him. I am your master now. This is not your realm. Get back into the fire plane. Where you came from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks back at the long snake-like humanoid who's standing there who glances at the other one and goes, "She wants us back. Very well." And they all turn around and begin to slowly drift back towards the center of the Cindergrove where the flickering light was.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, Keyleth!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know what happened, why are we clapping?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're turning around, they're heading back in that direction!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I fly back over to them, still in fire elemental form--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whoa whoa whoa!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm like: You guys! Did you see that! It was really crazy! Did you see? Did you see? They think I'm their leader! They think I'm their god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is she talking in normal, or is she talking in the (flickering flames).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (flickering flames)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no idea what you're doing or saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very scary right now, dear.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Is she going to be sick?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so. I might have to tackle you if you don't calm the fuck down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I chill out. I chill out, I can't revert back, though, guys, because I want to stay in this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the fire elemental is just like (calm whoosh). And it's more of a smoldering sad elemental at the moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give them a fire thumbs-up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Strong sad elemental.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First word. Two syllables.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, they're going back. Do we move on?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keeping my eye out for any elementals that might be escaping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is her game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but it's on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Vex, make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll high.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pressure!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Use one of your good dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perception.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And roll bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should've used the good dice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep! Wait, are you exhausted?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On everything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Skill check. Roll again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, even better!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Even better.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's the earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's the earlier one, yeah. Okay. You just see, as you're all just walking along, your new blue dragonborn friend just reaches down and snatches something from the dirt, pockets it and keeps walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see what it was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea. You just see a little cluster of ash and dust on the ground that's been partially disturbed. All right. As you continue to press forward, you hear in the distance a loud cracking sound echoing, and you can see what appear to be a number of trees in the far-off side to the northeastern side of the forest, as a brief whirlwind flickers up. You assume this is probably from the Fire Ashari, who've taken that side of the entranceway, and you can see two flickering lights drift up in the air before sparking out in the distance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we let them know we're in place, then?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll throw up a Skywrite. Or actually, as a fire elemental, can I just be like (fire flares) in fire elemental form?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you can make some localized fire happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I send up a little bit like a flare?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in the way you would want to, you'd have to drop form for that and cast a spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to set an arrow on fire and shoot it up in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't realize she's doing it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you go ahead and take the arrow-- What do you have around the edge that are going to-- are you just going to light the shaft on fire?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm going to tie some of my cloth from-- you know-- that I have-- The thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take some cloth from the Bag of Holding, from one of those old fancy cloaks that we have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Better ask first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sighs) Seriously?! Can I have some of the fancy cloak? Grog, out of the Bag of Holding, please?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, are you hot right now? It's so weird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus Christ. Please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, all right. Fancy cloak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. The arrow arcs off. Vanishes across the little bit of the remaining treeline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No idea if they saw that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Do you guys continue to press forward?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hold for a second. And wait for Team Three's response?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a third team?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, there's a third team. Three teams, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All the other teams already responded. We were the third.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! One, two, we were three. Okay, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You begin to push further forward towards the center of the Cindergrove, as you're noticing more and more of these trees are pushed flat. It's almost like that Russian forest the meteor had landed in and exploded; all the trees are flattened--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Tunguska.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- and you can-- Everything all right, Ryan?

lines.name: RYAN
lines.text: I am not here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not here, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You guys see him too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. As you can see, all these elemental entities are swirling around. There are two more of these strange, snake-like humans, these salamander-like creatures that are discussing, and one really large one that stands there holding this strange trident-like structure, and it's shouting out commands left and right, and you can see these salamander entities and a number of these elementals are all gathered around the portal, and they're all just focusing this slow, steady beam towards it. And as you can see it tearing, flickering and slowly expanding with each popping expansion of this doorway, the ground itself shifts and rumbles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I Hunter's Mark the big one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Can I send a candle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to, yeah.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right, what am I looking at, here? Fire? There's a bit of fire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a lot of fire. Most of these entities are either fire essence or just made out of straight flame.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'd like to call over the skeleton known as Fatty Arbuckle. I'd like to give Fatty Arbuckle an Ice Storm Candle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: And ask him to kindly deliver it to the center of this melee that's happening just up ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Won't that kill your friend?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh. He's had a good run.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm feeling a lot less guilty, suddenly.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, I can do it! What I don't appreciate is when other people do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fair. That's fair.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You know, it's my choice. Never said it was okay for you to start lighting them up with arrows. Jesus Christ, whoever that is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm Vex'ahlia, nice to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fatty Arbuckle, skeletal claws clasped around the side of this marbled-looking, bluish-white candle, and clutches it and just goes (snarl).

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes, off you trot, go!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have to demean him as he goes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really hoping for a Fatty Arbuckle skeleton impression. I was really, really hoping for it. What you did was cool, but like, that was just my heart.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: They can't speak. They don't have voice boxes or anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it shuffles forward, down this ashen pit towards the dome where the lava itself is beginning to pour forth and the doorway is, you can see the shadow of its form as the light passes. It looks like the cover of The Thing, how it's just bright light coursing past this dark image of the skeleton, walking away from you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should duck down, so that nobody knows where that came from.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, yes, get ten feet back, I should've said that already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look at each other. One of them shouts out in Ignan, which you understand, Keyleth, shouting, "You! Who walks here?" Just keeps walking forward like a little wind-up toy made of bone. Until eventually, the one with the bow gives a nudge with its head, and the other salamander entity draws a heavy-bladed object and begins to step forward towards it, ready to go ahead and cleave it. As the skeleton steps forward, it gets right at the corner of its range. Do you want to command it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like Helen Hunt in that moment in Twister.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Squeeze the candle, Fatty Arbuckle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, the skeleton, just as the blade sweeps past and crashes into its torso, shattering the rib cage, the arms go (crack). The wax bends and cracks in the center, and there's a brief pause where nothing seems to happen. And a swirl of sudden, localized storming blizzard just encases a ten-foot radius, hitting both of those salamander creatures. What does it say on the candle specifically?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: On the Ice Storm Candle. All affected must make a dexterity saving throw, DC 12, or suffer 4d6 cold damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a fail and a save. And it's half damage on success?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Half damage on success.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. Okay, so one of them failed and one of them saved. So go ahead and roll 4d6 damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dang. I think that's a good way to start.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Three, six, nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So (bang) it blasts open. Oh, and a dexterity check for your buddy, who makes it! So, Fatty Arbuckle actually walks out of there with a mere five points of cold damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice, Fatty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Out of ice and frost. His busted-open rib cage, though, he did suffer...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Super duper!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Putting on the Ritz!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did suffer seven damage from the impact of this weapon. So Fatty Arbuckle, pretty damaged, but still standing there just going (snarling).

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Keep standing, Fatty, you can do it! I love you, Fatty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is everyone just going to sit back at this, or--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we should probably attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you. Or you can watch this horrible bludgeoning of this skeleton in the teeth of death.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When I see the salamander take out the big, shiny sharp thing, I go into a rage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Travis, I assume you're going to be rushing in there, then?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone who wishes to immediately go into battle now, let's roll initiative.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm in on this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Let me go ahead and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For Fatty!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So these are all fire elementals. Should I continue--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, hell yeah.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Ah, nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we roll for stealth again, or are we still stealthed?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I was just shouting at a skeleton.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, back away from you as you were doing that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it a candle, though? It's like a thing, like there's no--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I mean, Gern was shouting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a candle the way the wheelie things are hoverboards. I think it's weird.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: And they also catch on fire. They also explode.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so this is quite a ways away from the portal itself. Lava flow traveling around that side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, look at that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and we have Keyleth over here as the fire elemental.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're at the portal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's okay. We're all going to die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where's the big one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The big one that you haven't seen yet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The big one that I Hunter's Marked.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That one. The one holding the tridenty thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. Look at how pretty those lava bubbles look!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that Gern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have Fatty Arbuckle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fatty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And chilling over here, we have Coral and Stimpy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is that crater? Is that just a crater?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that's the portal they were trying to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So these are fire elementals, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They seem to be fire-based creatures, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, DM!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said they were ripping open the portal? Where is that on the map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's back, it's this far back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Way back, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That crater's just a crater, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There is a pool of magma that goes this way. You guys are on one side of it, and pushing this way further, the rest of the actual portal's back this far. All right. So, initiative order, we have 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking Percy. Jesus. Every time. You motherfucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fast as fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 20 to 15.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16. Carl!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, great. So, top of the round, Percy, you're up first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First thing I'm going to do is I'm going to use my pistol. I'm going to do a trick shot for the arms. Actually, the first thing I'm going to do is I'm going to use my bonus action to-- you know, actually, I'm going to hold off on that. I'm going to make an arm shot to the one with the trident.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was my first shot. And that's 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's a strength saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength saving throw. That is going to be a 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That just barely makes it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aw. The blast of your impact (bang) hits the arm. He manages to hold onto his trident-like weapon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine. He's going to take his damage, and then he's going to take another one of those, because eff that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because eff that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of damage. All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm going to take another shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Scanlan, you're up on deck, by the way, so be ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He dropped that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Failure. (gunshot) You see his fingers are pried off as one of his pinky fingers is actually blown off from the impact, shooting dark, deep crimson blood that seems to burn the landscape around as it drips, the trident tumbling to the ground and getting lodged in a piece of rock, almost ready to spill into part of the lava.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that does seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage, all righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Third shot's going to be a sharpshooter shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So minus five to the attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's probably going to miss. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14, unfortunately, misses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. That misses. I'm going to take a run behind and hide behind that rock outcropping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There? Okay. Got it. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I see that big thing in the back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This big thing here? Yeah, the fire elemental. You see that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. And the thing next to Fatty Arbuckle is also a baddie, yeah? They're all baddies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These things are all baddies here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, and you watch out of the corner as well, Gern, you see this tiny little gnome step to the side, conjure some arcane purplish-blue energy, and then thrust his pelvis forward as a bolt of lightning energy just rockets forth, tearing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From my penis.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Nice. Of course.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just felt like I had to make that clear.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, I don't think I've ever seen that happen before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So many times.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Have to get that looked at.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slamming both into the larger salamander creature and the elemental behind it. Go ahead and roll 8d6 damage. What's the DC on this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it my spell save DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the hand-cone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh! That is a failure and a failure!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So full damage against both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oof. All righty. As the bolt of lightning energy tears through both of them, eventually absorbed into the stone behind them, the elemental flame form flickers and falls to the ground for a second, trying to reform itself, while the salamander looks down at this blackened, burned char mark in the center of its torso from where the bolt entered and exited out of its back to strike its compadre. Not too happy, and confused how such a large, damaging thing came from such a small little creature.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's powerful. Then I'll turn to our new friend Gern, and I will inspire him. I'll say, please, help us, and to inspire you I will sing you a song. And I will sing--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Pretty inspired by your dick lightning, to be honest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, there's more.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You think a song's going to get better than that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It might! It might. And so I sing (singing): To everything, Gern, Gern, Gern. There is a season, Gern, Gern, Gern. I just like to sing your name, Gern Blanston. Did that help?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Do I have to roll to determine if that was helpful or not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you'd like to.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Certainly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20 for musical taste.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four. It catches you by the ear with delight.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's not bad, actually. It's not bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your general frustration with modern music is completely bisected by the more oldies, classical sound of his tune.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No one's ever done that before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get a d10 inspiration dice.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So just keep that on the side. If ever you make an attack roll or a saving throw that isn't as high as you want it to be, you can then roll that and add the d10 to that roll.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Okay, great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you just have that in the wings, as you feel inspired.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll try and remind you if something affects it.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Thank you very much. Excellent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That brings it to the elementals' turn. Now, this flame elemental is going to streak over (whoosh) to Blern who's-- or, no, sorry, this is to Fatty Arbuckle. There's too many weird names tonight. And this larger fire elemental here is going to--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, Fatty. He served me well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, he's got a fighting chance. I love that we were scrambling for d6's when we have this right in front of us.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Are there any dice around anywhere?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we going to find...?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just waiting for the hand to go in and just--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I found this polyhedral vase and I had to fill it with nine pounds of dice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He went the long way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's not doing anything, he used his whole round to get there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The air around you is blistering. You can feel your hair curl back in its presence. The small elemental is going to go ahead and make two attacks against Fatty Arbuckle.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Ah, shite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a nine to hit. I think his AC's 13, so I don't think it's going to hit, yeah. Second one rolls a one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fatty lives!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fatty just don't want to die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't keep Fatty down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bob and weave, Fatty, bob and weave!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Don't step too hard, Fatty! You won't be able to take it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, Grog, it's your turn. So you go into your rage at the top of your turn, and then what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use, I guess, my entire action to run towards Scanlan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your speed again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, ten, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40. You can get right there between Scanlan and this creature if you want to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's about it, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say that's your movement. You can move ten more feet if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can leap over me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, we need to spread out. Can I go back and arc the other way? Can I run to the left as far as I can?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This way?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, from where my starting point was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you mean like this way instead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, back towards you, around the pool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's about as far as you can get, right there. If you do not attack anything, you would lose your rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I fall out of my rage, yeah. So I fall out of it. Can I throw something? I guess I can, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can throw your weapon if you want to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I attach the Chain of Returning to Craven Edge? And I'll throw it at trident-less bastard right there, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. So you watch as this muscle-bound goliath comes leaping around the corner as it affixes a chain to the edge of its weapon, flinging a two-handed sword like a giant boomerang and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14, against the larger one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, it makes an impact, but it just ricochets off of its plated body armor, and then tumbles to the ground. You can go ahead and make your--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thing to pull it back. Strength. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, no problem. You pull it back with the chain and catch it mid-air. Ending your turn there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keeping my rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I rev up the Boots of Haste and I'm going to run right next to Vex'ahlia, on the very edge of the map. And the fire elemental there's right up against Percy, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I'm going to stab him three times in his fire buttocks. First one is a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Second one is a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Third is a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here come the dice. Two, four, seven, ten, 16, 21, 27, 28. 28 plus two is 30, 36, for that first with sneak attack damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oof! His form flickers briefly for a moment from the sheer impact of the dagger hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Second dagger does seven, and third swipe does nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gern, you're up. So you're right there.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm right there. How far can I run and cast a spell at the ones around Fatty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 feet is how far you can run, and that's about six squares.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: If I were to cast a bit of-- how about a Cone of Cold, could I cast a Cone of Cold at the fire elementals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could, you could very much so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That sounds delightful.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I could cast Ice Storm, but that's a general malaise of middle-aged couples living in a neighborhood, becoming aware of their dead-end lives.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you want to move around here?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes, let's move around that bit right there. And I'd like to cast Cone of Cold. I might unfortunately have to take out Fatty, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's probably a good chance, this is not going to be-- After everything else Fatty's survived, his own master deals him the possible finishing blow.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I feel like I should be the one to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's much more humane.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's poetic.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You brought him into this world.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: This is what Fatty would've wanted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything under that area gets affected. So yeah, you could do that.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yeah, don't worry about it. It's fine. No big thing. This old spell? I mean.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Y'all want to go to the DQ and get a cone of cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your spell DC? It should be at the top of your spell page.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It is 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, all right. And it is a constitution save, let's see if they make it. That is a failure, a failure, and a failure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about Fatty, did he succeed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I'll roll for Fatty. Fatty does not succeed. Nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was inevitable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. All right, go ahead and roll 8d8 points of cold damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jeez. Oh man, these are not used a lot.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I have four. Let's see, I have a whole-- there's another one here... They're not that easy to get to. Two, four, six. I need two more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two more? Good gravy.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Is this one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Here's one, and... D'oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is why I sort my dice at the beginning of the game...

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Sorry, it sounded like there was something coming from the other side of the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taliesin, you don't have a d8?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Do you have a d8 I can borrow?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I actually don't. I don't know what happened to my d8's. I'll buy some at the convention tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the way, guys, if we hit 16k before the end of tonight's show, we're going to go ahead and have a sloth come into the studio.

lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: 16K and a sloth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know! I know!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When? When?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An actual sloth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it going to play with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we hold it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Focus, focus.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (mocking Gern's accent) Farty-far pints o' cald damage!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I don't think I appreciate that very fucking much! I'm saving all your fucking arses out here! For crumb's sake!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, by its side you see three very still frozen-solid statuettes of the remnants of the two salamanders and Fatty Arbuckle. Taken by the cold of winter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit. That was awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you can reanimate him.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's too late. He's no good any longer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Freezer burn?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Move on. I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the purposes of remembering that, too, put a couple of: frozen, frozen, and frozen.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (singing) Let it go, let it go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Awesome. Wait, so they can unfreeze? Or are they basically frozen until something--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans) Okay. That yellow one behind me, that's Keyleth, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You believe so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I know, right? I'm going to flip backwards like ten feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, right behind it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to be around anybody else, so I'm going to flip over the lava pit and go out there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, don't burn your foot. Ooh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be 38.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two-point landing, on your feet, knee down, still clutching your ready-to-go bow, unscathed by the boiling cauldron of molten rock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I Hunter's Mark the guy attacking near Percy and Scanlan and I shoot two arrows into him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, right there. Go for it. Two attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (giggles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're on deck, Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 17 on the first hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then 18 on the second hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! Both arrows burn to ash when they impact, but the sheer blow and the magical energy behind it from the bow that you threw it from hit it and you can see it begin to shake its form even more, itself. Did you do the Hunter's Mark damage as well?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good. Cool. That end your turn, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Work with me here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right, whatcha got, whatcha got?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So here's what I want to do. I want to go low and dive into that lava pit in front of me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Sounds scary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I want to-- using the lava around me to rise out of the lava and look really scary and badass, and then I'm going to shout to the living elementals, I'm going to be like, hear my warning! I am your new master! Retreat to the Fire Plane or meet your imminent demise! This is your last chance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pretty good. Pretty good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Way better than last time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks! Thanks, guys. And if you'd like to meet for coffee later I might be available.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say, given the use of lava control in this, they are still elementals, go ahead and make a persuasion check. No, intimidate, this would be intimidate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Okay. That's better than my persuasion. Let's do this one, that one rolled a one. Get out of here. Get out of here. 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? You can see the smaller elemental here that just watched its friends get frozen solid, as well as whatever that skeleton was, turns towards you, and (snarls) and begins to make its way this direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Away? That's cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Towards the portal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The large one doesn't seem prominently fazed by your display.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. But that one's peacing out? Do I still have an action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say that whole thing of bringing up the molten rock and the shout and everything would be your action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You knocked one off the plank, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I knocked one off the plank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. All right, ends your turn, Keyleth, brings us to Percy.

lines.text: I'm toe to toe with that one right there, aren't I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's right up in your space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's in my space. Okay. I'm going to draw my sword, I'm going to try to do a back and forth. Let's see how this goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a swipe at it with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a 30. That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. You take nine points of fire damage, as just striking it, the flames burst back and burn towards your face and torso from the impact.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I put fire resist on you? At the end of last game?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, you did! I have fire resist on me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you take half damage.

lines.text: So that's how much? How much fire damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be four. Four damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four damage? Four damage. Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. And roll damage for your strike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh! 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hmm! All right. Do you want to make a second attack, you said? Or are you just going to keep going back and forth, what's your plan? Whatcha doing? Whatcha doing, Percy?

lines.text: He's being a dick. I'm going to try and break away and back up, I'm going to try and roll away from him to be on the other side of the rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you roll away, it's going to take an attack of opportunity at you. That is an 18 to hit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My armor class is 18, but I'm going to use my shield for plus five to my AC, so that won't hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it strikes out towards you, streaking its elemental claws outward, you back away, instilling the power of the brooch, and you see an arcane shield temporarily ricochets, pushing its claw away from you. You run away unharmed to the other side of the rock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Instead of going to the other side of the rock, I'm going to run straight back, and I'm just going to shoot at it as I run away. I'm going to make two more shots at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm going to take one more shot, because I have to reload. That's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow! Holy cow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Elementals aren't very hard to hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that was amazing. That's ten points of damage. And then I reload.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you reload. All right, that ends Percy's turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your call.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to take a step towards Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And away from Gern, right? So is Gern 15 feet away from me yet, so far?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's 15 feet from you, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. So I will then cast Thunderwave, which should not hit Gern, but will hit Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that a 15-foot radius?

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cube, so you can just make the cube here, and it'll hit none of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Oh, great. I'll do that. And I'll do it at level two. Thunderwave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, level two Thunderwave. Coming on up. Oh, it's a self. A 15-foot cube originating from you, so yeah, so you can hit that guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, originating from me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. So, level three, that's 3d8, let's see if it makes its constitution saving throw. It does not, not with a natural seven. So go ahead and roll your damage, 3d8 thunder damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20! How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan Shorthalt!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I send the Thunderwave out by cracking my knuckles, and as I do so, I do: ahem, Gern, might want to check this out.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, I'm looking at something over here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gern!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll be with you in just a minute, I'm dealing with something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gern, I'm doing something really cool here.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll be with you in just a minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck. So I do it anyway but with a scowl on my face.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right, what did I miss?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, I was just, why didn't you wait? I just said a minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, forget it, you had to be there.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right. I was here, but you didn't-- you should've told me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You even missed your own Thunderwave spell, you were so distracted with your frustration. You look back, you cracked your knuckles, and it's gone, but you didn't see it happen and it's a little disappointing overall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I kick the dirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys look over as this elemental runs off towards the glowing doorway you see further down this passage. It's not that far away from you, but you do see the flickering doorway that's like (sputtering). You can see other entities beginning to step out of it, and you can see one larger form. It looks fiery, humanoid, just (crackling) comes out, lower body made of ash and cinders.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rush that way and look for my other tribe. Can I see any of my other tribemates?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're running at them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So if they're frozen, does that mean they're dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go find out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They'll probably melt eventually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can I walk over there close to them?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What'd you say? Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. Currently, from where you stand--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, sorry, sorry. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. From where you stand, you can look off in the distance, you can see parts of the treeline across, down the Cindergrove, shifting and moving, and you hear the distant sounds of combat, but you do not have a visual perspective. It looks like the other teams have not quite made their way to the center. You're actually the first team to get here. And you made your way around a possible encounter, and in doing so, arrived before the other teams did. However, it looks like a secondary line of defense is now pouring out of this doorway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I make my way to the two frozen statue-types?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's three statues, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or three of 'em, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Including Fatty Arbuckle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fatty Arbuckle. Can I make my way over to one of them and-- should I just make sure they're dead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, just push 'em over, smash them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, can I push Trident-dick over?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As you shove-- and it's a pretty heavy form, especially with the ice that's, you know, formed around the body--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --but not too hard for you, Grog, because you're Grog. You give a little shove, and as it topples over, it just shatters into 100 pieces.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, like the T-1000.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I dunno.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do the other one now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, can I go over and do the other one, like, (giggles).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This time, you give this one a full push, this one actually gets about ten feet in the air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cow-tipper!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before scattering across the ground, pieces of it actually spilling into the molten lava. And there stands, frozen in place, Fatty Arbuckle, chest destroyed, arm limp to the side, just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I pick him up and walk him back over to Gern and go: sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the half-giant goliath handing you the frozen body of your skeletal friend.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, I don't know what I'm supposed to do with this, now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't want him?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I mean, he's not very-- maybe we could have a quick burial.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could hang a coat on him.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: So we basically would just carry him around as a coat-rack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't we have company incoming?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it close by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to Critical Role.
