lines.text: Go back to your fire slit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up. Unless you want your dudes to do anything, by the way. They're still over there dancing.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: They should get a little bit closer and dance in front of him, just to make sure. They get very self-conscious if no one's paying attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just cheering on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At least they're dancing while I'm standing on fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I knock him down a notch? Can I try and shoot him to drop him out of the sky a bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try. First of all, I'm going to Hex him. He's hexed. I point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the Hex moves over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hex moves over. And I'm going to take a shot to try and drop him. I'm going to take a grit shot to drop him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's, what's the saving throw for that? Strength throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength? 23.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aw, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine, he'll just take his damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Little bitch. Plus 1d6, don't forget.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow, Disintegrate spell fucked him up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 17 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to shoot again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is this with your pistol?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, just with the pistol right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And what's your first range increment on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pistol?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. 1,200 for Bad News.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your first range increment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sharpshooter, I have no range increment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. Good call. All right, so fire again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Range increments are for-- We don't do that here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a 31 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, roll damage. Scanlan, you're up next, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's 16 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. (two impacts) Just as it manages to cauterize the wounds from the Disintegrate spell, both bullets blast into its torso, and you can see it's now, thinking the height advantage would be helpful, after being locked in a hamster ball and now being repeatedly blasted from every which way, it's not enjoying its current experience by any means.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to get worse. All right, and now I'm doing a sharpshooter shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pew pew.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pew pew. That's 18?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's 12, 18, 28 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! This one (impact) blasts into the center of its chest, and you can see part of its pectoral muscle tears open and flame erupts from the impact. It reaches up and (snarling).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Action surge. Fuck this guy. Same thing, sharpshooter. I'm going to be rolling sharpshooter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get the other nipple, now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The other nipple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Matching piercings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits. This is going to be a rough round for him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 27 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Reload and one more shot!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus Christ! I mean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Reload, one more shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a hit. Go for it, roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 21 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (two impacts) These holes are beginning to appear in its body where the bits of fiery flesh are being blasted away from the impacts of your weapon. All right, that brings us to Scanlan!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It didn't kill him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, but he's a sieve now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys held him--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He just took 100 points of damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He took a lot of damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, that Ioun stone that I have? Does that allow me to cast a fourth level three spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If the spell you put into it was a fourth 3rd-level spell, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a 3rd-level spell, so it's an extra 3rd-level spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm maxed out on 3rd-level spells, but I still have that thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so it wouldn't be a 4th-level spell because you didn't cast into it as a 4th-level.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I mean, the fourth time I've cast a 3rd-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, got you. It wouldn't count against your daily. It's in addition to that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay! So I will, for the first time ever, use that stupid Ioun stone and cast Lightning Bolt again. I'm just sticking with my method here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, all right. With a five, it does not make its saving throw. Go ahead and roll damage. 8d6.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 8d6, thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here comes the cube.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Did you do this one too? 28!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Both kills! Both of them!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I would like to, if there's a way, I'd like to angle it somehow so that he will drop right on top of Grog. I feel like Grog can do something to a falling behemoth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard-pressed from this angle, unfortunately. Grog is at an angle where you wouldn't really be able to do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mind you, when you blast him, he'll plummet close to his feet, if you wanted to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, yes, let's do that so Grog can feel like he gets part of this, too. And if I can, I'd like to burn a big S in his chest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you charge up and blast the lightning bolt from your crotch region, you then do a little dance maneuver with your waist, causing it to (crackling) carve a Scanlan S into the torso of the efreet. As it plummets to the ground, slamming into where the lava would be, while the fire doesn't hurt its form, you can see, Grog, as it stands in the ground (groaning). Its form is turning into ash around you. It's actually just dissipating and turning to ash as its eyes roll up and meet with yours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I run over in the lava and I go, I'd like to cast Beheading!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You suffer 26 points of fire damage, reduced to 13 from taking another round in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not a problem. Totally worth it for the spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you take Craven Edge and take the head off. As the head rolls away--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You grab it! It turns to ash.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (panting) I run out of the lake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get out of the lava, stand on the side, and look over just as the rest of the head turns to ashes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up to Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You did it again!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pat him on the shoulder, and say, that was so impressive. A genuine mage! And I use sleight of hand to shove the flying broom into the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll sleight of hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, girl.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Am I allowed to roll a perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Vex. Come on, sister.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 16?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: 15 plus one, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're dealing with this, you have no notice of this. You may question it later, if you like, but you have no idea where it went, and didn't see any of this transaction happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Oh no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, what is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your broom fell in the lava!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw it!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I just turned around for a moment!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tried to give it back to you and it fell in the lava!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You shouldn't have looked at me when I cast my spell!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: This is why I never looked at you before!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was wrong to doubt you!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No! No, you're a constant source of disappointment!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Where's my fucking broom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check now.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Insight. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. She's telling the truth, man. That broom just went straight in the lava.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're a horrible person.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You know, I'm really good at reading people, and I know that you're telling me the truth right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, I feel your sorrow. I feel it. I feel bad for you, that you have to experience that! It's just a broom. Right? It's just a flying broom that's very difficult to find, no big deal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wouldn't know. I don't even know.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That's all right. You know, it actually-- It sterilized me, actually, I'm quite glad. It has very dirty properties. Anyone that would put it between their legs to fly around would be in horrible danger. Horrible danger. So it's actually probably for the better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Communicable diseases?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yeah, so many STDs. It's really just like a disease tampon, is really what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A what? Is that like a magic candle?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's sort of like a magic candle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A tragedy candle.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's a tragedy candle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A Blanston candle.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't understand sorcery at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you hear the flickering of flame and the portal itself has begun to expand even further, glowing brighter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth throws up a Skywrite spell and says, we're taking the portal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As this is happening, the flames themselves grow higher and higher. The lava begins to boil and roil. As you guys all move up to the side, you can see the lava is beginning to (bubbling) splash out and spray bits are starting to scatter as some of the nearby trees tumble over. You can see the four Fire Ashari as well as Korren come across one of the clearings. The other way, you see what looks to be another salamander gets thrown about 15 feet from the trees, hits the ground, skids, and is motionless as you see Cerkonos with the rest of the Pyrah, the Fire Ashari stepping through. "Keyleth. We saw your symbol. Is it time?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Let us try to close this rift." And the rest of the druids all begin to gather around the outside of this portal. As it's flickering, you can see, piercing into the extremely blinding light, Keyleth, you take a moment, and using your attachment to the Fire Ashari and the Fire Elemental Plane from your last passage through it, you can see past the brightness and see beyond the doorway. You can see on the other side, there appears to be probably another half dozen or a dozen or so of a few other elementals and salamanders that are now making their way towards the portal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stand next to my father and join the rest of the druids.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, you should probably help them with all of your magic powers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think so? It feels like it's an intimate thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just hold your hands up, hold your hands up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes (gasps), "We need more power!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you can aid, whatever you have to bring to this, please, now is the time!" Does anyone wish to help with the ritual?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, how would you wish to help?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What a nice guy he is! Certainly not someone we should swindle!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Strange that you would say that.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I would know if someone were trying to swindle me, believe me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. That is true!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You all have honest faces. Particularly her, over there. Very honest face. What can I do to help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you think would lend itself to a fire gate-sealing ritual? It could be a spell, it could be a use of a skill. How would you like to--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A candle? Do you have any candles that could aid?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like fiery candles, maybe?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I have a-- No, this one casts-- This is bright light, there's a thunder candle. Blink candle. Destroy-- No, that destroys dexterity. I have a thunder candle, but I don't know if that would work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. The Blink candle, which you crafted from various parts from blink dogs and other creatures that have natural translocation capabilities, might have the capability, as this is a doorway between planes, and teleportation magic is based on creating short-form doorways between similar spaces, might have some impact on the ritual if used properly.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I have this Blink candle. It's formed from various animals that blink and if-- that has trans-dimensional properties, very good properties. The best kind of robust properties that I can throw it in, and it might help stop the-- from-- all of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That makes perfect sense.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Right. So we're all in agreement, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well-explained!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right. So I'm going to hand Blink candle to Coral and I'm going to have Coral walk into the portal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Brave Coral.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Brave Coral. Fuck, I've lost two and my broom. What a fucking terrible day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Coral takes the candle, (groans) turns around and begins to just slowly melt, steps into the lava.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Run, Coral, run!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of fire damage to Coral who was already sitting at--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And had taken six damage, right? So 15 from 33. Coral's at half health. Coral, as this is rough terrain, gets part of the way there, then continues walking forward the rest of the way. Takes an additional 17 points of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's 32 points of damage. What's Coral's hitpoints? 33 is the max?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what you said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. On the sheet right there. I can read my own text. 33 hit points. Coral, at one hitpoint, gets up to the lava, take the candle and (boof). As the energy expands from it, you can see a ripple, a heat wave ripple, that billows outward. Coral vanishes entirely and the portal shrinks down by about five to six feet, actually closing in its space

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, Coral, I forgot to tell you somethi-- fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly you hear a (zip) and Coral appears about ten, 15 feet in the air--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh good, there you are. Listen, did you see my broom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Smack! Coral falls those 15 feet, taking six points of bludgeoning damage. Let's see if Coral survives this with Undead Fortitude. Nope. That is a roll of eight versus a total DC of 11 with the damage taken, and Coral just splats like a really, really old orange just slammed into the concrete, just (splatting).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like an old orange.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the Fire Ashari goes (cringing, gagging) and just ends up concentrating on holding the gate.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm starting to think you're all very bad luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, that did aid the ritual. We have two more folks who could aid in this ritual.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can use-- I don't know if it will help, but I have a really great diamond of awesomeness that's precious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How would that help the ritual?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I a part of the people who could be included in the ritual too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Oh yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I am going to cast a 7th-level Plane Shift to help smush it closed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and make a nature roll with advantage. This is your understanding of the natural elements of the world around you and the connection you have with the fire elemental plane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how this magic stuff works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I'll teach you later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 12. Oh, with advantage. 23

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you can see the lava flow in the mountain begins to slow and the bubbling begins to come to a stillness. The portal itself shimmers again and then shrinks down to the size of a normal doorway, about five foot by ten foot tall, and it's just barely holding on. As you're concentrating on holding it in its place, you can see now the rest of the druids around are sweating profusely. Who wishes to take on the last part of this ritual?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a Firebrand Warhammer. I could hit it. Anybody else got anything better?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have any magic stuff, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can inspire them. I mean...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your Dimension Door?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have your Dimension Door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dimension Door what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A door. I did Planar Binding, which technically really wasn't supposed to do what I just did--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Planar Shift you said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Planar Shift, I mean, yes. 7th-level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finding ways to tailor magic essences into this type of a ritual.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I know that that will work or help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. You'll find out. However you wish to aid this ritual and justify how it would be helpful in this instance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's something I could do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, spit it up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I whip the Cape of the Mountebank out of my pocket and run at that door and jump off the edge and just try to balloon umbrella it down over with that red cape.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hmm. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Matador it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm doing it. I'm matadoring it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I will say-- hmm. How do I make this work? I'm going to want you to go ahead and make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. That is a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You rush up, leaping off the side, spinning in the air. As you, do you unfurl the cape and turn it into a limited parachute-type projection and as you slam it down towards-- I need you to go ahead and make a wisdom check to see if you have the capability of triggering the magic of the item at the right time to be impactful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cross your fingers, everybody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No bonuses here.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No whammys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't still have our fancy feast, do we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah, are we still feasting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what does that mean? Advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have advantage on wisdom throws.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's better. That is 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13? That's better. As you come down, you take the cape and encase, you trigger the magic, at which point the remainder of this doorway just blinks out entirely, the cape gone. The doorway, gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hot hot hot hot hot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Vax (splashing) right into the lava.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a Grasping Vine from the edge and try and yank him back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take 22 points of fire damage as you splat into the lava.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Deathwalker's Ward is set to fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it resisted to 11. So you (splashing) in the lava. All of a sudden, images flash in your head of the time that you lost most of your foot in the Underdark. And you go--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No no no no no no no no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And, before you can even react, all of a sudden, something wraps around your waist and yanks you out as a vine pulls you in an arc and slams you into the hard obsidian floor on the outside of the lava flow. The rest of you gather there as the rest of the druids finish their concentration. The lava pools themselves have gone still and you can see elements beginning to cool, and there's currently no sign of a tear between the elemental planes that's currently bursting through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice job, Vax!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where am I, am I near her, on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She would be back here. You're on the ground, right next to a dancing skeleton.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I moved up, I moved up. I would be over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would be part of the ritual. But you fell next to the dancing skeleton.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm an idiot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You did good. You did good. I reach down and I help him on his feet. How bad are you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pretty bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I Cure Wounds, level four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dark, weathered skin, long jet black hair cruising down to the middle of his back, approaches you and his one right arm he puts on the shoulder and says, into your eyes, "I do not know you, friend, "but you have come to our aid at an hour when we really required it."

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Great, sure, I just thought I'd come and lose a couple of thralls and my fucking broom. But great to be here. Everyone seems nice. Especially her, she's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He removes his hand. "Very well."

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Let me know if I can do anything else! Do you want a candle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Candle?"

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, I make candles, just various candles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does this and his finger bursts into flame and you can see a flame flickering. "We do "not need candles here in Pyrah. But thank you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that the finger? Or is that the finger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Insinuated, actual finger. At this point, Korren, your father, approaches you and places a hand on your shoulder, and turns you around to look you in the face. And you can see there's smears of dirt and still glistening from sweat from the whole ritual and looks a bit weathered and winded from the experience. "Keyleth, I'm proud of you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, Father.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think we will stay here and help the Pyrah try and rebuild.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he takes your chin and pulls it up and looks you in the face with a broad smile on his face, he says, "The road before you, Keyleth, is hard and fraught with loss and sadness. To live is "to struggle against the void. But it's those moments of darkness that define the joy of the "world around them. Learn from the loss and push forward as a beacon of perseverance, of hope for "life after pain. This is one of the pillars of strength of a leader. One that I have learned with the "loss of your mother. But you are my beacon of hope. And to many more than you even expect." And he looks back towards the four other members of the Zephrah tribe that are all just looking at you, and they nod.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope I do not fail you, Father.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I trust you will not. Go forth, while we stay here. I want you to grasp your destiny, "vanquish this terrible beast that lies on the shores of Tal'Dorei. Complete your Aramente."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you know that this is my destiny?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whatever your destiny is, grasp it. But you've chosen this path, and all destiny really "is, is the choices you make, leading towards a goal that perhaps you do not yet understand. But "when you've returned I wish for you to teach us the wisdom you've gained on this journey."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kaitiaki, father.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kaitiaki, Keyleth."

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Did you see a broom lying around anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right, we will keep an eye out for it though."

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: They'll know what it means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is a hashtag?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll explain later.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, unless there's anything else, we have business to attend to in restoring this area. I "wish you all great luck. "

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Korren, If we should ever need you-- if I should ever need you, or the assistance of the Ashari, what is the best way to get hold of you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Call to Zephrah. Come home. And we will come with you." As he looks over all of you, giving each a look of-- a nod of respect and appreciation-- ("Don't You" by Simple Minds plays)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I felt it coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glances past to Grog, Vex, and lingers a very long look on Vax, and just gives you a nod.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His diamond earring is glistening in the light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did I stutter?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Stay safe. For her sake." And Korren turns around and walks back, as the rest of the Zephrah Ashari walk along with him. You, through all this chaos, get a little bored and frustrated with all this weird nonsensical stuff, look at the ground and realize there's a lot of hidden treasures scattered amongst this vicinity.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Probably so. You know, I might stay behind a bit and dig around for a little while. You know, candlemaking's a difficult business.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it now?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Aye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So, if you make your way north.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Excellent!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're always welcome.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Thank you. Could someone heal me a bit before you leave? I'm quite singed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up and I cast Cure Wounds on him. I've got jack shit.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: She's so nice!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's great.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: She's the nicest!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At a level three for you!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That's really nice of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're a really good person.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am! I am. 20 points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This gentleman has done nothing but aid us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, and it's so kind of him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's suffered the loss of three of his--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at all these treasures he's going to find here for his candles!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anything we can do to repay you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That scimitar that the genie had, did it fall into the lava?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look down and say "all these treasures around," you get a closer look. The ground here is rugged rock and black ash and dust and pieces of charred and burnt, petrified wood, and right around the outskirts of where the lava pool is, you can see what look to be broken slivers of soot-covered dragon scale just peppered throughout the landscape. Barely visible until you look real close, thanks to the constant barrage of blacken soot and dust that falls from the nearby area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you collect dragon scales for your candles?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: And so I spent my whole life trying to figure out how to turn scales into weaponized candles. Anyway, got to go, everyone have a great time! Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just leave?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I leave! Scoop up some of the few scales and piss off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as Gern Blanston begins walking around and, like a gutter snipe, or one of the people on the beach with a metal detector, starts combing through.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (singing) Don't you forget about me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gern! Before you leave!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Aye?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, we're killing a very, very large dragon, hopefully rather soon.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Very interesting! Where would that be?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he's in Emon now, but we're gathering our forces in Whitestone.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Good to know! I might catch up with you later on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Good-bye!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good-bye!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which she says with a strange doppler effect even though he's but 20 feet away from you and has chosen to ignore the rest of your party to go about his business.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's just like an NPC, just Skyrim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your skeleton's in the background dancing.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: There's only one left!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, only one left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's freezeframe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's plenty of charred corpses littered all over this mountaintop you could make undead from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does the skeleton go with him, or does it stay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It follows him. All right, so the rest of you, what is your next course of action?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keyleth, why don't we head home?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which home?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we get to Whitestone, can you bamf us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go there and rest up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, thank you guys. Thanks for coming, for helping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your dad is very noble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your homeland is, you know, I mean, the volcano, the magma, the monsters, the fire torn in the sky, it's lovely. It's charming, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, Scanlan. This isn't my homeland. I appreciate how well you know me after all these years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I thought you lived here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, this is the Fire Ashari's camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not a Fire Ashari?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm an Air Ashari.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all right, it's only been a couple of years.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't all Ashari the same?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what, Scanlan, that might be the most questions you've ever asked me about myself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't even know your last name!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't have one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, what's a hashtag?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Gern! Gern! Gern! Gern!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it just dragon scales, or is it any dragon parts you use?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You know, mainly dragon scales, but I do like to see them blown apart, so that part's merely for pleasure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You could give him five pounds of dragon scales.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pick a tree that's big enough to fit all of our fat faces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You already cast Transport via Plants this day, that's how you got here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we should rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you need me to help you with the tree spell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should just sleep here and rest up and spend the night, wake up in the morning, head back to Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's going to still be there next week, by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, Vox Machina leaves Gern to his business as they go and camp out at the base of the mountain.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Did someone lose an orb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, we're going to finish tonight's game! (laughter)

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Can I say something from this realm?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm delighted. We showed a thing tonight on @Midnight of someone lounge singing Stand By Me to Donald Trump and putting the name Donald in there, so I told everyone, please tweet that to @Wilw, and people are fucking doing it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's amazing.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: So, if you find the guy singing a very poor rendition of Stand by Me to Donald Trump, please send it to Wil Wheaton, he'll love it! Favorite thing in the world!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heard it, guys. Critters' call to action. Make it happen.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: #FeelTheGern.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: CritterStrong.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Feel the Gern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, well, guys. Chris, thank you so much for coming and hanging out with us.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Thank you, this was so much fun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A week without crying!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Feel the Gern!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: The best DM in the world! This is a wonderful party, and you're all fantastic. Thank you so much. I'm not even upset that you stole my broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't judge me, Scanlan, you didn't see me do it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't! I didn't!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sam's just judging.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a definite distinction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't worry, everyone will judge you when you take it out and use it for the first time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex is fine. Laura Bailey? Awful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's wanted to fly so much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beat him by one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And is it Thursday yet? See some of you guys tomorrow, and if not, next week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Peace out!
